>>34093157
>posing as victims who act like they are crazy
Wouldn't Occam's razor be that some people who think they're being gangstalked are just legitimately delusional while others are actually being stalked? The idea that the government pays people to act like paranoid schizophrenics to discredit actual gangstalking is pretty convoluted imo. Paranoid delusion has been around for a lot longer than modern entrapment operations, psychological warfare tactics, surveillance technology etc. So I don't think feds would have to fund fake schizos to make people think that every example of paranoia about stalking is delusional, it would be most people's first assumption to begin with, which presumably is why glowies are able to get away with it in those cases that it's actually them.

The idea that gangstalkers are private citizens paid with gift cards also makes no sense to me. For an operation that sensitive, wouldn't you want to keep the people involved to people you can be reasonably sure won't talk like FBI agents? If you went outside the intelligence agencies it'd probably be to "private" intelligence agencies. And if you absolutely had to pay private citizens to help you, why would you pay them with gift cards instead of money? If the idea is that a direct deposit would be to on the books, wouldn't cash be better? And if they're worried about money trails why are they using private citizens to begin with, since they have less incentive not to talk?

Most of the confirmed examples of stuff similar to gangstalking that I'm aware did not involve random people. Zersetzung was the Stasi using a network of civilian informants so that's very close to what's being claimed by T.I.s but the ebay thing kept it in the company, FBI entrapment operations keep it in the FBI, that case where some local PD and fire department were harassing some guy because they wanted him to sell his home was kept inside the PD and fire department.

When I was like 12 or 13, we had a 'camp out' in a friend's back garden for her birthday. Bit of booze going about and some people got wasted but most remained relatively sober. I had a few drinks but was totally compos mentis

Later on at around 1-2 in the morning, several of us were sat in camping chairs outside of the tent, just chatting whilst those who got severely pissed were asleep on the inside of the tent.

About 5-6 times at random intervals, there were these all encompassing flashes of light. Very brief lasting probably a quarter of a second each, no particular pattern to them. Happened over the course of maybe 10 minutes or so. They seemed to be coming from the sky, no obvious source. When I say all encompassing, I mean that in the sense that it was literally flash that illuminated everything, whited out your vision for that brief period.

We all saw it, never worked out what it was. Clear skies, no thunder. No idea what it could have been but was weird as fuck

>Just finish a long ass shift at a restaurant I used to work at. It was around the holidays and we were fairly busy.
>We're closed and I'm in the backroom alone getting my stuff together before I leave.

>There are about 3 or 4 other people closing up with me, so I'm not completely alone or anything. Not really important to the story but just some context.
>As I'm collecting my things there's still music playing over the speakers throughout the restaurant.
>At this point I'm tired but I was used to my hours and felt completely fine and normal.
>Downtown by Petula Clark starts playing.
>Have never listened to this song before, but I felt a wave of uneasiness the second it started to play.
>Instantly feel lightheaded and numb, I stumble backwards and almost fall down, catching myself on a shelf.
>Sit on the floor and feel very weird and paranoid, have never felt this way before. It was what I imagine a panic attack would feel like, I guess.
>I sit and breathe until the song stops, that's when I get myself up and I instantly start feeling better.
>I have no history of fainting or anything of the sort.
That wasn't the weird part though.
>Like two days later.
>Guy in Nashville detonates a car bomb, before exploding he was playing sounds on a speaker.
>He was also playing Downtown by Petula Clark.
>Probably a massive coincidence, but it's still very weird. I have never reacted that way in regard to anything before or since.
>Also, we were a "sportsy" bar place, why did we have some old ass slow 60s song playing? I worked there for over a year and that was the first and last time I ever heard that song play. All our managers (managers were the only ones that could change the music) were in their late 20s or early 30s so it wasn't some boomer playing old music he liked.
>It still confuses me to this day. Hopefully I'm not some sleeper agent that activates to Downtown by Petula Clark.

friend and I used to wander and have little adventures. We would sometimes make offhand remarks that would be revealed to be true while we did this, and it was uncanny how many small little coincidences happened or little predictions we made came true.

This can be excused as good intuition. Kids don't think conciously. They jump to natural conclusions and solutions that wordcel adults struggle to reach. It's interesting to think about.
Also, don't leave your keys near the door if you want kids to stay out.

I will share two stories. Both can be rationally explained, they’re aren’t extraordinary, but I felt like that character in Mulholland Drive (at the diner) who sees the hidden madness behind things.

#1 After divorcing my father, my mother and my siblings lived near the end of a cul-de-sac in a small English town. At the time, I was five or six. It was a Sunday night, and for whatever reason I slept in the same bed as my mother. We both woke around three, and rushed to the window. A man, followed by a helicopter search light was rushing from the end of our cul-de-sac, accessible by a footpath, and up our street. In a flash, he was surrounded by armed police(?) officers dressed in all black. My mother then dragged me away from the window and I quickly fell back into sleep. To this day, she affirms this happened and remembers only as much detail as I do. This was peculiar because it was so out of place for a sleepy town, and that I recall everything happening in complete silence. I can still recall the black silhouettes surrounding the man, and the search light. But not the man or the sounds.

#2 next.

When I was a kid my mom, my dad, and I were driving home late at night and saw a searchlight beaming down on the woods a quarter mile from our house. We thought we could see people walking between the trees but it was too far away to be sure. My dad was driving and he just raced out of there while my mom and I tried to see where the light was coming from. There was nothing in the news about a search, we never actually saw where the light was coming from, and we never heard anything (if it was a helicopter that low and that close how would we not hear something?).
I live near a big airbase so a lot of “UFO” stuff I just chalk up to aircraft I’m not supposed to know about but a silent invisible search vehicle looking for people in the woods is still something my family talks about from time to time.

It's not a cryptid or spirit story, but I do have one I can give you guys. A brief background though;
In Ocala Florida there is a a legend or myth called the Rainbow Men. It sounds like the San Franciscan treat, but it's just a group of hippies that live out in the national park/ woods/ swamp that are less tree huggers and more a band of rapists, druggies, murderers, maybe cannibals. So more like an LA treat or just an average group of Florida Men.

About two years ago I'm talking with some shooting buddies online and bemoaning the fact that I have nowhere to practice three-gun. One of them gives me some GPS coordinates for a spot hes used in the past when he lived here and I decide I should check it out because why the fuck not?

At this point I had not heard of the legend so I get myself strapped with gear: my AR, a 12 guage, and a revolver because I can't shoot a semi auto handgun for shit. I Load it up along with some water, rations, orientation gear, etc in a backpack and a tac vest; pile in the car and head out to the state park where I strap up and start marching inna woods.

>>34078553
I have myself a nice time and when it's about 6, before it gets dark, I pack up and start heading back covered in sweat and mud and stinking of BO, gunpowder, and blood. It's been a great day and I'm enjoying my hike back now that I'm a little lighter after having spent a good $200 or more in ammo so I'm thinking to myself and not paying too much attention as I walk through a deep ravine because fuck climbing it.

This is when I hear a rustling and immediately snap out of it, shoulder my rifle and insert the last remaining 30rd I've got in it and start scanning my surroundings. Contrary to what you may think Florida doesn't have very many large land predators dangerous to people save the swamp panther which is sadly near extinct, but it's not impossible that one may be stalking me.

I keep walking and I hear something again, scan, nothing. Then I check the ravine top. It's an old yuppie looking couple in white and pink and all manner of vomit pastel and neon mixes crouching down and watching me like it's fucking TES or something and they want a stealth bonus. I just do what comes natural without thinking and wave while saying "Hi there, how y'all doen'? Trails that way." and point at my heading and keep on walking. The man screams "Run RUN!" and they book it in the OPPOSITE direction. I don't think much of it, but when I described the situation to a coworker when she asks what I did for my three day vacation she laughs and says they probably thought I was a rainbowman and so I went home that day and looked up the legend.
I became someone else's inna woods story.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>34079565
>look back to the lights, catch 2 of the three lights making the final rotation around the right side of the craft and then darkness
>can no longer see any indication of craft, a literal second later roommate and I exclaim about the bright orange light that started shining in the distance where we just saw the craft, hundreds of miles away
>roommate and I Wtf the rest of the way home, mention it to eachother every so often
>I still reside in the same area, never see anything like it again
>no longer in contact with that roommate


This whole sequence of events probably lasted a good 20 - 30 seconds.


I'll never forget this strange occurrence, and I've tried to rationalize this a lot throughout the years. Man made commercial craft usually, to my knowledge, have lights on them that indicate which side is which for other air craft to identify them in the air. This thing I saw had none of that.

Only the lights I explained so I know it wasn't any of what you usually see in the sky.

Another thing is that I live in Arizona and this wasn't too far from Luke Air Force Base so it could very well have been expirimental military craft but I really doubt it. Keep your eyes to the skies, brothers. They're out there.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Small handful of personal ones surprisingly:

Before I hit 10 I was walking to my friends house down the neighborhood when I saw a dog walk out of the bushes lining the road maybe 50 or so feet ahead of me. A dalmatian.
It sniffed around for a bit, took a piss on the bushes then fucking stood on its hind legs, took a few steps into the street then turned and looked at me. Not shambling steps, very natural and deliberate ones. I screamed, pissed myself and then ran back home crying. I still have no answers and it haunts me to this day.

When I was in college I was star gazing out by a stretch of road over a swamp in Gainesville and me and the girl I was with saw three green lights moving in formation, slowly spinning like it was a triangle lazily rotating through the air. They then started slowly doing individual figure 8's around each other that quickly sped up before they suddenly shot off in different directions in the night sky.

For a few years back I got night terrors of a tapered cylinder that would stand in the corner of my room but where filled in with tv snow/ static. They made no sound and emitted no light. I only had this experience two or three times though and never again. Never did anything, just stood there. Like a rip in realities fabric or something. Apparently though that's a common one.

That dalmatian still fucks me up.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
I used to work security in an industrial park, as the only guard on duty. There were 5-6 corporate offices we woud patrol, with large parking lots and some light forest in between. We would do the shift handoff at midnight in one of these lots, basically BS with the oncoming guard for a while to let them know if anything was going on.

One night an extremely dense fog rolled in, you could only see maybe 20-30 feet in front of you before everything became a wall of white. Shit legit felt like the Silent Hill otherworld.

So I'm fiishing my shift at midnight, talking to the oncoming guard, mainly just cracking jokes in the middle of this giant, empty, foggy parking lot. Suddenly we both stop talking as this white orb of light floats through ourvery limited field of vision. It was shaped like an oval maybe 6 feet x 4 (hard to tellexactly), and passed about ten feet from me, moving from our rear-left to right in front of us, then receding into the fog over the course of 2-3 seconds. It looked like a dim light without a source, like it didn't emanate from anywhere.

>Me and coworker both stare into the fog.
>You see that?
>Yep.
>You're gonna leave me out here with a ghost.
>Yep.
>Get in car and drive carefully home.
>Never talk about it again.

That campus was weird, the cleaners refused to be in one of the bulidings after dark becuase of creepiness, but I never heard any other reports of orbs/lights again, and were out there every night of the year patrolling.

In 2010 I was hanging out with my room mate in his attic bed room playing video games. Suddenly we heard a strange noise from the sky that sounded like a helicopter. The noise got louder and louder, so I opened the attic window and looked outside. I didn't see anything out of the ordinary but the noise got even louder and louder, as if a train was passing through our house. We both ran down the stairs and my other room mate kicked open his door and asked what the fuck was going on. I answered idk while the noise got louder and louder. At this moment the noise seemed to be coming from every corner of the house and it sounded like some kind of trumpets. The three of us ran downstairs and I kicked open the front door and ran outside to look what the fuck was going on above our house and where the loud noise was coming from. The moment I kicked open that front door the noise instantly disappeared and we were just standing there like a bunch of retards. We could never figure out what the fuck it was. very strange and I still wonder to this day what the fuck it was but i know that I wasn't the only one that heard it and it wasn't normal.

me and my life long friend have both seen the same "ghost"? We saw it about a year apart in different parts of the same town.

I was driving down a country road at maybe 11 at night. Saw some tire tracks start in my lane and go on for a long ways, maybe 100-200 yards then veer off to the shoulder. At the end of the tracks a dude in a black trench coat with long black hair was staring at his feet. He looked solid, like a normal human. This happened in the middle of nowhere, maybe 10 miles from a gas station or any houses. There wasn't a car or anything. It shocked me and I honestly didn't know what to think of it at the time. I never forgot it but didn't know what to think.

My life long friend saw and described seeing this EXACT same circumstance to me on a different day a year or two later on a different road in the same town. It could be some local goth setting up this weird scene for some reason, but that's about as believable as ghosts existing.

All respectable women, be they a man's virgin daughter, a man's wife, or a man's widow must wear a veil when walking through a man thoroughfare of a city. Their hair must not be uncovered.
As for unrespectable women, be they a man's concubine, a slave girl, or a prostitute, they are not allowed to wear a veil, with one exception. I would like to say one last thing on this.
While there is no evidence for sacred prostitution, that doesn't mean that the temple of Ishtar is chaste, or patriarchally normal.
For instance, you have the pi-li-pi-li (pilpilu), who had the head over turning rite performed upon them (sag su-bal) This ritual was attested to turn a man into a woman, and a woman into a man according to the poem In-nin Sa2-Gur4-ra (Lady of the largest heart in.120)

There also seems to be a struggle between the forces of the Palace, and the forces of the Temple, attested in the Song of Erra;
"As for the city of Uruk, the dwelling of Anu and Ishtar, the city of Kezreti, Samhatu, and Harimati
Whom Ishtar kept from having husbands, and put under their own authority
Sutean men and women emitted a clamour,
They drove from the Eanna-temple the kurgarru and isinni temple performers,
Whose masculinity Inanna had changed into femininity in order to induce awe in the people.
As well as the bearer of swords, and the bearer of razors, knifes, and flints.
Who to make Inanna joyful, continually break taboos.
You, Erra installed over them a dangerous, ruthless governor
He mistreated them and transgressed their rites.
Ishtar became furious and irate at the city of Uruk. She roused the enemy to loot the land like grain on the surface of water."

There is no evidence for the temple of Ishtar to employ sacred prostitutes, especially on a large scale like that seen depicted by Herodotus. However, they did often break taboos, and frustrated the local authorities with their bizarre(kinda gay) behavior.

>>34088182
Finally, I'll also note this.

My issue with Sacred Prostitution isn't rooted in the sex aspect, but rather that Temples were so much more that what people initially think.
The Mesopotamian governments were two headed institutions. What we would consider a government was split between the forces of the Palace, and the Temple.

Both the Palace and the Temple owned land, The Palace oversaw royal judges, while the Temple oversaw economic guilds. They both had armed forces, whether it be the Palace Guards, and the Army, or the Temple Guard. They both owned a good deal of slaves. The jobs a priest/priestess would have in a Temple setting, is closer to that of the responsibility of a civic leader than anything else. They'd be scribes, administrators, counselors, economists, among a myriad of other duties. They'd be responsible for taking care of the poor, constructing hospitals, and even arranging ransoms during wartime.

A interesting example of a priestess, comes from the Naditu of Old Babylon. They worshiped the God Marduk, God of justice. They lived in a cloistered monastery, and were not allowed to leave after nightfall, but could arrange business during the day. They were initiated in pairs, a older Naditu would take in a newly initiated young woman Naditu. They would live together, work together, and the older Naditu would share all her businesses with the younger one. They were not allowed to get married, or have sex with men. Once the older one dies of old age, the younger one would inherit her entire estate, to keep it within the Monastery. These Naditu ran a number of businesses, and even offered some of the world's first banking systems. Loaning money to the poor, for a price. If the person in debt failed to pay up to the Naditu, they'd get sold into slavery by them to make up the cost. Of course it's debt slavery, so they'd only be a slave until their debts are paid off.

OREGANO DOSING GUIDE

POMEGRANATE DOSING GUIDE

Does oregano also provide benefit? Let's take a look. Delayed-type hypersensitivity is a reaction that MS patients have to a microbial source (fungal) that triggers a delayed inflammation response. With MS you don't want this happening because the immune response (for instance IL-17A or IL-22) causes further damage to the myelin sheath. This leads to common symptoms like tremors or motor instability. How does oregano benefit?

"Mice treated with thymol or carvacrol had reduced DTH responses (26% and 50%, respectively) compared with control ... As carvacrol and thymol each suppressed the antigen-specific immune response by reducing THcell-related cytokines\specific transcription factors, this indicated their potential to modulate destructive immune responses attributed to T-cells over-activation."

Reading between the lines, one of the pathways that carvacrol downregulated was IL-17A. This pathway is specific to fighting fungal pathogens.

Aaaand then .... Repost for Science

Cryptococcus is the most advanced fungi in the CDF genre. It builds biofilms that are highly resistant to antifungals and targets the lungs and brain primarily. It uses Chitin as part of its cell membrane, similar to a crustacean.

Chitosan works effectively against Cryptococcus and it's biofilms, which can appear odd at first since it also uses Chitosan in it's membrane.

>Chitosan severely inhibitedC. neoformansstrain B3501 from forming biofilms at concentrations > 0.04 mg/ml.

>C. neoformansbiofilms were significantly susceptible to chitosan after 0.5 h treatment with 1.25 mg/mL of chitosan resulting in a reduction of approximately 50% when compared to untreated biofilms. Furthermore, treatment with ≥ 2.5 mg/mL of chitosan for 1 h resulted in ≥ 75% killing.

>These biofilms showed scattered aggregates of polysaccharide after treatment with chitosan.

>The concentrations of chitosan used in this study to evaluate fungal biofilm susceptibility were not toxic to human endothelial cells

So it's literally ripping the biofilms apart, even at small concentrations. How does it do against free form planktonic cells?

>C. neoformansbiofilms were significantly more resistant to chitosan than their planktonic counterparts ... the metabolic activities of planktonic cells were significantly reduced 40 and 80% after treatment with similar concentration of chitosan

https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2783412/

This appears to be a very promising additive. If it doesn't outright kill crypto, it heavily reduces its polysaccharride capsule, making it susceptible to antifungals and immune response.

The only downside is the potential allergic reaction. It should not be used if allergic to shellfish.

This completely misunderstood the hindu concept of flat earth.
Bhu mandala is flat like disk with 7 planes with 7 seas in between each plane which hides one plane from another. The confusion starts in the purana when they say bharata/bhuloka (earth globe) , bharata kanda (continent where earth resides which is jambadivpa, bharata varsha (the part of the universe where the continent resides), etc.
Read more about this cosmology because it can be interesting and confusing but it can be compared to those flat earth theories of land beyond Antarctica ice.

I cant show you, since the image was taken on an observatory during summer camp, but I specifically remember when me and my colleagues were working on imaging the sky to look for NEOs (near earth objects, aka asteroids), one night when we were imaging we saw a straight line covering the entire image, when everything else was small dots.
The only thing that could of been is a satellite, since every image took 5 minutes of light absorption to complete, since we were looking at distant, dim objects, and the satellite covered the entire length of the area we were looking at in those 5 minutes meaning it left a straight line as it reflected light all the way across.
And before you ask it couldnt of been something like a fly since a) we were looking at a couple degrees of the sky, with massive zooming, a fly would take up a significant portion of the screen and b) a fly probably wouldnt of traveled in a perfect curve

I will preface this by stating that none of this will be greentext, and that any spelling mistakes can be attributed to English not being my native tongue.
I have never mentioned any of the following stories before, except for a few mentions between my family and I, so I don't know why I'm posting this now, least of all on this site. I suppose I need to get some of this off my chest, I'm 23 now and some of this still haunts me to this day.
I had a strange childhood, I was raised by my grandmother and my mother, although my grandmother really was the more parental figure as my mother has no authority and treated me more like a friend than a child, making it hard for us to have a normal relationship. We never stayed in the same place for long, essentially living a nomadic lifestyle, the most time we ever spent living somewhere before I was thirteen was six months.
I thought it was normal until I started to go to school at fourteen honestly, I wasn't allowed to have friends or talk to other children, I was homeschooled and wasn't allowed to use internet or read non approved books before then. So while I realise now that it was some kind of abuse, back then I wasn't especially unhappy with my lot in life as I wasn't aware that I shouldn't be living like that. Think of it as being a Mormon without a community if you will.
Now, with the detachment that years have shed on those years, I realise that it might be less about religious fanatism and more about the strange events that kept happening through the years.

The first story I can personally remember is what I will call the rabid fox incident. I remember it clearly even now, as if the fear I felt then has made a permanent mark on my mind.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Back then we had been living in a townhouse in London for about three months, and we ended up staying in that house for six months, the longest we ever stayed in a single place, or a city really, in all of my childhood years. Perhaps because my grandmother actually owned the house, and my mother had grown up there, which will be relevant later on in the stories.
A rather simple layout, a ground floor with a kitchen, living room and office, a below ground floor giving out to the front and back garden with two bedrooms, a bathroom with a shower and a storage room. And the first floor, with two more bedrooms, another bathroom and access to the attic.
But the thing that fascinated me the most was the back garden, it was fairly big, and horribly overgrown beyond a small tiled area in front of one of the bedrooms which had direct access to it. It seemed like a jungle to my six year old self and I wanted nothing more than to explore it.
I wasn't allowed in the garden alone, probably so that the neighbors wouldn't see me (although there was a tall brick wall surrounding it and none of the windows of nearby houses gave a clear view of the overgrown area), and no one would let me play beyond the tiled area when I was supervised.
And I was often home alone, long enough for even the most studious child to get a bad case of cabin fever. So one sunny afternoon, when I was sure that no one would be back until the evening, I simply slid out of the door and gleefully rushed towards the great outdoors. I had a great time crushing snails and kicking over old garden statues for about an hour before I got tired of it, and settled down next to the old bird bath, now covered in ivy.
There was a fox den in my line of sight, but I was partially hidden by some bushes, and I had seen the fox that lived there through the window before. She had two fox kits, and fascinated by nature as I was I hoped to catch a glimpse of them if I was quiet and still enough.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
So I sat down in the dirt and stared at that fox den with all the determination a six year old can conjure.
Eventually, perhaps worn down by the excitement and subsequent boredom I fall asleep. When I open my eyes again it's much colder outside and the sun is starting to set.
I remember being worried about getting punished, but before the worry grows enough to make me run back inside I hear some noise not far away and turn to look at it. Sure enough, there's a fox sitting near the entrance of the den, with it's back turned to me. No kits in sight but she's very close to me, perhaps two meters or three away, and I am so amazed by the closeness that I stay silent and unmoving. She's moving her head in a jerking motion but I think nothing of it, I thought that perhaps she was grooming herself.
But then, slowly and with what seems like great effort the fox stands up and starts to turn towards me. Something instantly seems wrong, the fur around the face and the neck seems matted with some dark substance, it's a bit shiny like tar, and her jaw is hanging open as if she couldn't close it. I'm not afraid at that point, but I'm concerned that she's seriously hurt so my reflex is to call out to her and I start making those psspsspss noises you make at cats.
The head instantly snaps towards me, no real movement, just, one moment I can see the fox's profile and another she's facing me, as if there was missing frames. The fox starts to make a horrible sound, as if you had put rocks in a blender, and the smell of rot reaches me.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
I'm now nauseous from the smell and a bit apprehensive, but being the stupid child I am I still don't move, we stare at each other for perhaps seconds, perhaps minutes, as the noise continues without interruption.
She jumps straight at me, but I'm frozen in place and can't even flinch as the fox clears the two meter jump and almost reaches me, jaw still hanging almost to her throat. She seems to crash against something in the air because something stops her momentum and lands not far from me, completely still for a few moments.
But the sound never stops, and after a few moments her body starts convulsing violently, big jerking movement that look unnatural.
At this point I finally gather my wits and start legging it back to the door, stumbling over old pots and my own feet in my terror. I reach the door and safely make it back inside, but I remember that the sound cut off as soon as I reached the open area of the garden.
I spend about an hour terrified, hiding in my bedroom until my mother comes home and I spill the beans on what happened, too scared to care about punishment. She says that she will lock the garden doors from now on, but she didn't seem surprised at all.
I never saw the fox again after that, nor her kits, but for weeks after we would find traces of a black, rotten smelling substance on the outside walls and stairs, as if it had been rubbed there. I wasn't allowed back into the back garden even supervised, so perhaps that's why the encounters stopped there. But I swear there was something horribly wrong with that fox, and I'm sure it wasn't rabies like I was told.
I will be back with other stories later, it's late and I need to work tomorrow.

You are not an intelligent person. You have no observational skills.
Those shots were made with a wide angle, "fish-eye" type lens, not rectilinear. I can tell because of how distorted the horizon on the left is (at ground level it shoul appear flat), and how exaggerated the curve of the earth on the right it is ( it should be much more subtle, they are still within the atmosphere, not even LEO).

posts.com:
We have been conditioned to think that we live in a physical world governed by physical laws; however, attempts to strictly define our reality using simple logical principles has failed (see Godel’s incompleteness theorem). This physicalist type of logic has also invaded how we use language to communicate with each other. We think that there must be a clear and objective way to define all of our words. We are told, “Before we can talk about consciousness, we must first define what is consciousness.” But no definition that we can come up with is sufficient to account for consciousness. Does this mean that we cannot talk about it? Or that we do not know what is consciousness? In this episode, we explore the problem with accepting that the dictionary is true, or accepting that tomatoes are fruits when you clearly would not put one in your fruit salad. Finally, we close the episode discussing David Bohm’s suggestion that we live in a holographic universe where the entire universe is reflected in each one of us. Within this grand context, our natural language is woefully inadequate to capture the ineffable truth of our reality. The best we can do is to more carefully explain with our words how our mind came to see things the way that we see them now. By more honestly portraying the functions of our mind, we can avoid making strong truth assertions about the world and avoid slipping into unproductive arguments with other people.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2v1pIB1nViQ

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>34033077
119 is probably the strongest.
>This psalm is one of about a dozen alphabetic acrostic poems in the Bible. Its 176 verses are divided into twenty-two stanzas, one stanza for each letter of the Hebrew alphabet; within each stanza, each of the eight verses begins (in Hebrew) with that letter.[13] The name of God (Yahweh/Jehovah) appears twenty-four times.
>The acrostic form and the use of the Torah words constitute the framework for an elaborate prayer. The grounds for the prayer are established in the first two stanzas (alef and beth): the Torah is held up as a source of blessing and right conduct, and the psalmist pledges to dedicate himself to the law. The prayer proper begins in the third stanza (gimel, v. 17). Like many other psalms, this prayer includes dramatic lament (e.g. verses 81–88), joyous praise (e.g. verses 45–48) and prayers for life, deliverance and vindication (e.g. verses 132–34). What makes Psalm 119 unique is the way that these requests are continually and explicitly grounded in the gift of the Torah and the psalmist's loyalty to it.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Psalm_119

It's very simple. When you do the Psalm Magic formula with EVERY Psalm (set a desire, read the Psalm out loud once as an incantation, then read through it again to find the occult meanings), then that's one degree of initiation. Doing it again counts as another degree, and so on. You don't have to do the Psalms in order. Don't forget that Psalm 119 is broken up into multiple Psalms.

Not recommended to rush the process, since the wisdom comes from deciphering the meanings of each Psalm. If you feel like a Psalm's calling you to go over it multiple days, do so.

Source: Ariel Gatoga and Pater Amadeus mention these in their booklets.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>34015108
>>34015413
>God promised to give back 10x (tithe means ten) whatever's offered to Him
horrendously false. Tithe means tenTH, as in you are to give a tenth of your income (money but also produce itself as most people in history did not have income in money). The tithe was not a generous gift but required in the Mosaic law, it was to sustain the Levites and priesthood and for maintenance of the temple. This was how they stayed alive as they were not given any land inheritance in Canaan, the tithe was God's provision for them.
There is Scripture that says if you give (freely, so not as part of the tithe) to someone who you do not expect to be able to pay you back, God will repay you. But the implication there is not that the "repayment" will be a literal monetary gift or any specific concrete blessing. Rather it is that you aren't simply throwing away resources, God sees what you did as an act of kindness and obedience to His Word and He will not forget.

God owes you nothing and He never will. Any blessing you have received He gave you because of His immeasurable grace.

>>34052695
>to be fair the whole bible is "trust me bro". I'm still undecided whether or not paul was a false prophet tho.
Paul literally says "don't trust me bro".

Romans 3:7 (KJV)
For if the truth of God hath more abounded through my lie unto his glory; why yet am I also judged as a sinner?

Later translations try to cover up for Paul, saying that he was hypothetically speaking for someone else (like the NIV translation for example). However, it's clear that he's talking about himself, because he directly misquotes the Bible multiple times.

Isaiah 28:16
Therefore thus saith the Lord God, Behold, I lay in Zion for a foundation a stone, a tried stone, a precious corner stone, a sure foundation: he that believeth shall not make haste.

Paul twists the quote like so:
Romans 9:33
As it is written, Behold, I lay in Sion a stumblingstone and rock of offence: and whosoever believeth on him shall not be ashamed.

Deuteronomy 30:14
But the word is very nigh unto thee, in thy mouth, and in thy heart, that thou mayest do it.

And again Paul changes the meaning to suit his teachings.
Romans 10:8
But what saith it? The word is nigh thee, even in thy mouth, and in thy heart: that is, the word of faith, which we preach;

The former clearly says "that thou mayest do it", as in, to uphold the law through your actions, in direct opposition to Paul's "you just need faith bro".

In other words, Paul misleads "Christians" like >>34046788 that thought that what Jesus said to do was too hard.

Once you have something that looks like this;
TLIMS;ISNW
HMELDIGP;HLMBSW
HRMS;HGMISPFHNS
YTIWTTVOFSOD,IWFNE,FTAWM;TRATS,TCM
TPATBMITPOME;THAMHWO;MCRO
SGAMSFMATDOML;AISDITHOTLFE

You should then be able to look at this and recite it without reading the words. Finally, you just keep repeating it until it's part of your memory.

>People only want what's easy without wanting to be better, and will disregard parts of spiritual texts that do not satisfy them. I see this in every form of New Age 'pick what I want, from whatever I want' systems. People see the word 'magic' and assume that it doesn't require them to cut sin from their lives.

I find it really interesting that in Judaism, this process of cutting sin is a logical one in addition to a matter of faith. A lot of weight is given in the process of derivation of the laws through logic, it's a mathematical approach to belief. All that said, I struggle to rectify years of biology, psychology, and ethics which in many ways come to similar conclusions about the nature of evil/sin (selfish gratification) and good/virtue (control of base impulses). Now that I am interested in restoring my faith, I find it difficult to not hear years of study of the sciences overshadow religious texts with the scientific reasoning. I am not saying that it is wrong to learn science - just that it makes this so much harder. We know that much of this wisdom was boiled down to simple terms and allegory to be interpreted for the masses in a communal setting through years of study. This is an aside but it's one reason why it makes me so angry that there are people who interpret the texts literally. These texts are supposed to be mulled over and meditated on over a lifetime.

I feel that the only way to overcome this struggle is to go even deeper in the religious texts and attempt to achieve wisdom through mysticism. That requires a lot of dedication. Psalm magic isn't a one and done, it's a process. If you're not up for the process you won't reap the benefit.

Still I do feel better reading the psalms. It's alleviating the pain while I'm going through one of the worst episodes of my life.

>>34087537
>what are subliminals?
They're ways to bypass the gatekeeper of the subconscious mind. Mantric sigils are good for beginners. Say you want to become more confident, you'd write down an affirmation like "I WILL BECOME MORE AND MORE CONFIDENT EVERY DAY." Then rewrite it but misspell it deliberately, for example: "EYE WIL BEKUM MOAR AND MOAR CONFIDUNT EVREE DAE". Then remove all spaces and repeating letters, i.e. EYWILBKUMOARNDCFTVR. Then break it into two or three parts (EYWILBK UMOARN DCFTVR) and rearrange the letters to make a magical sounding phrase, adding extra vowels if necessary. You'll end up with something like YILKWEB ORANUM FRACTOVIR. You can then recite that phrase every day with rosary or mala beads, record it on a loop and listen to it while you sleep, or write it down and pin it somewhere off to one side in your home where you won't necessarily notice it but your subconscious will see it in your peripheral vision every day. I like to transcribe the English letters into runes for a bit of extra magic.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>34087894
Adding "not" isn't really about letting go, it's more of a trick to bypass the gatekeeper of the subconscious mind. The gatekeeper rejects ideas that are not consistent with your current reality or self-image as a way to protect you from self-dillusion. So if you affirm "I am a millionaire" it may resist that. If you affirm "I am not a millionaire" it won't put up any resistance and will allow that to slip through, but since the subconscious doesn't deal in negatives the affirmation will impress upon the subconscious anyway. You can include "not" in your mantric sigils if you like as an extra layer of redundancy, but it's not necessary as the layers of obfuscation in creating the mantric sigil already perform the task of bypassing the gatekeeper.

It really depends on the person in question and how inconsistent the subliminal affirmation is with their current self-image. Also some people are more auditory (sound-based) or kinaesthetic (emotion/feeling-based) or digital (text-based) than visual, so they may not respond as well to video subliminals. A lot of people recommend using subliminals for at least 21 says which is supposedly how long it takes for new pathways to physically form in the brain, but there are instances of subliminals working after a single viewing/listening. The famous hypnotist Milton Erickson one mindfucked a lazy kid with terrible grades into passing all his exams by simply asking him "How surprised would you be if you pass all your exams next week?" because his question contained the subliminal embedded command "Pass all your exams next week!"

1 After David was settled in his palace, he said to Nathan the prophet, “Here I am, living in a house of cedar, while the ark of the covenant of the LORD is under a tent.”

4 “Go and tell my servant David, ‘This is what the LORD says: You are not the one to build me a house to dwell in.

The important thing to understand about energy work is that it's secondary to contemplative (IE: meditation) exercise. It's purpose is to direct the energy cultivated during meditation into specific uses and results. This could be health, in order to become a better meditator, or it could be towards esoteric goals.
Western practice has been disrupted numerous times by various political forces. The model for western practice SHOULD look like;
>Purification (mostly of environment since west generally follows the miasma model)
>Contemplative practice/meditation.
>Energy work
>Ritual.
Where it was about developed to before lineage breaking;
>Purification
>Meditation/Contemplation
>Ritual
But with lineage breaking it's typically reduced to
>Purification
>Ritual.
Or even just
>Ritual.
LBRP, MP, ROSY CROSS, ETC all fall under purification practices. These target the environment around you instead of trying to change your subtle body. The most they'd do to your subtle body is make it so you can act as a constant banishing ward, but that's about it.
This is the long way of saying that the western corpus of esoteric practices are fine to integrate with energy work. You'd wind up essentially recreating the old chinese church practices, wouldn't hurt anything.

>However, Freemasonry soon was to develop more esoteric dimensions, especially in France. Andrew Michael Ramsay (1686–1743), a Scotsman, was a member of the Philadelphian Society of Jane Leade and Francis Lee, a theosophic circle in London, and subsequently he went to live in France.
Ramsay, who had been initiated into Masonry years before, rose in the French Masonic hierarchy, and in 1737 he gave a famous lecture. In this oration, Ramsay called for a massive project of universal illumination, a joining together of the arts and sciences. He echoes earlier Rosicrucian aims, but there is a more rationalist quality to his work, and it is arguably the case that he served as predecessor for the later French philosophes and their Encyclopédie. But he also linked Freemasonry to the Knights Templar, to aristocracy, and to a kind of mystical chivalry that was very attractive, particularly to the upper class. Many para-Masonic orders thus were generated.
From Magic and Mysticism by Arthur Versluis, i did not know of this connection between Freemasonry and Christian theosophy but it's very interesting how Ramsay is through this also indirectly linked to the Strict Observance Templar group which was taken over by Willermoz and 'rebooted' as the Rectified Scottish Rite

On the basis of my limited experience I can say the Law of Assumption is the core of magic. Structured magic training helps to concentrate our development on some aspects and then we switch to others. Non LoA practices helps technical/scientific minds like mine too.
I practice LoA and LoA related techniques (not Murphy or Goddard), IIH, Kriya Yoga and NeiGong (internal martial arts). They are complementary and you can progress faster combining and mixing methods. Different takes of the same thing, split in different roads for different purposes by different ethnic groups. The core is the same, but each use different names. Some traditions are secret and incomplete like NeiGong lineages, but they can be reconstructed using the other traditions.
A lot of NeiGong that is public is very slow, but mixing with some other practice it becomes faster.
HGA is your subconscious or superconscious.
I have a book on practical Kriya Yoga who explicitly confirms that.
Anyway read practical texts and practice. Some things are natural and others are very difficult. Every person is different.
I am not using grimoires or witchcraft. I want to able to do things on my own without pleading for help to some entity. No one here is an accomplished magicians or we wouldn't be here and in other communities. I don't blindly follow namefags. I evaluate every suggestion but I decide myself.
Keep an open mind and follow your instincts.

Tantraloka 4:62:
>The purpose of self initiation is to mobilize the essense of the mantra which is being practiced. Mobilization of the essence of the mantra results in activation of self knowledge. It has been observed that if one is unable to get a teacher capable of activating the mantra, by praying to Candika Devi (Raktadevi) regularly, one becomes an Acarya within a month, a Sadhaka in a fortnight. A Putraka in a week, and within four days less by quarter of a day, Samayi.
In this process of initiation, Raktadevi is supposed to perform the ceremony Herself as the provision of the Shastras. This method is to be adopted in case of unavailibility of a Guru.
Abhinavagupta comments that you can brute force your way in by constructing your own mantras in accordance with lineal doctrines. Moreover, there's enough interspersed between Tantraloka and Paratrishikavivirana to do the exoteric form of worship and get a sense of mantra installation.
Tantraloka 16:195 is a self initiation via an ordeal of consciousness.
More interestingly, he appears to invite people to practice these rites without initiation to attempt jivanmukti, with the caveat that they recognize they aren't lineal representatives.

>>34086150
Can't answer yin-yang too well. I can however answer you about energy practices.
Sorry to say Anon, and you're not going to like this, but you're shit out of luck.
Everything that was real relating to qi gong was more or less wiped out. There's some books probably circulated in small circles of taiwan, but I sure as hell don't know them. The CCP eliminated anything relating to real qigong and replaced it later on with falun gong and faux TCM. This was a political move since qi gong practices were rooted more in buddhist tantra than daoism, which clashed against china's anti-foreigner policy.
The daoist manuals of qi gong in existence are often HIGHLY edited and distorted, finding a non perverted manual is going to be excessively hard.
You're better off remaking the system for yourself, the underlying principles of (atleast) buddhist energy work is the same everywhere. If you understand what's going on there you can reconstruct a working form of qi gong with what little of the practices remain.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>34089474
Most of what you'll find in the market on things like neigong or any system of chinese energy work aren't properly lineaged and are bullshit.
Your best chance on a direct qi gong book is going to be Shifu Yan Lei's book. It has problems, but at least he tries to practice genuinely.
If you want to reconstruct a qi gong practice using book sources;
>Tibetan Yoga: Magical Movements, Breath and Mind.
This is useful to grokk what's SUPPOSED to be going on with things like tai chi.
>Calm Breath, Calm Mind: A Guide to the Healing Power of Breath
Helps to understand what's SUPPOSED to be going on with chinese-buddhist energy work. Can give insight into wuxia.
>MUAY: winning strategy
Muay Thai is the most intact and uncorrupted form of buddhist martial arts that's survived. Covers things similar to yin-yang philosophy (buddhist version) and traditional buddhist energy work.
With all of these together, you'll have a working skeleton for buddhist energy practices. Meaning that you can reconstruct a fully functional qi gong model from the scraps that survived the 'cultural revolution'. Be it daoist or buddhist in thought.
Best of luck, Anon. Namo Buddhaya.

>Chinese Pure Land/Chan, but I also have been trying to study up on Chinese Vajrayana, though the sources for that are very limited in English.

Sadly a lot of the ritualistic aspect are washed away by western translators, there's funeral rites and prayers in Daoism but they're even overshadowed by the philosophical and the energetic "literature". Having a more folkloric/magical aspect is good, but the cultural abyss between the literature or the Taisho Canon and the practice by the people is quite considerable.

Everything you offer as a Buddhist, whether to the Buddhas or to any sentient being, is ideally done with the motivation of giving up attachment to the thing you're offering up. So the difference between Buddhas and samsaric beings in practice is primarily that the Buddhas don't need your offerings, instead they will multiply them for you and distribute the merits to the all sentient beings.
Of course on the deeper level when you offer to a Buddha, it's your own Buddha-mind you are calling upon.

posts.name: Abcd

As you know, in a singularity, or behind an event horizon, time and space breaks down. For a physicist, this isn't the end all be all, but for physics--which is a language, model, and system made using concepts such as time and space as its base-- the phrase "new physics" is common. Physics is itself a spatial term, so without a distinctive state of space and distinctive flow of time descriptively, how can events be said to ever occur?

Events don't have to have a form exactly. Some tendencies are to look for a source of an event. We find it, but for those who aren't looking directly at it, we have to describe it. But if it wasn't something we saw in a physical form, but saw as a structure of logic, there will always be a way to represent it in a form.
For an example to contemplate on: the expansion of space as a result of gravity. Consider it logically. Let's imagine we have four points arrayed as if in corners of a square. They aren't there, but we can see all four of them from there. Now these points can't be four points if merged. If we say they can not merge, and we also say they attract per gravity(and the gravity can not cause them to merge or else gravity has no parts to attract together), imagine a fabric forming under each point. The fabric expands and gets closer to merging so that the four points are able to obey every ridiculous rule placed upon. That's the thing with physics in the logical structure of reality: the universe, as if refusing to do otherwise, gives you a superposition every single time, self-resolves paradoxes. From this we can atleast determine that the beginning was without form, but that we can trust the non-sensory sense that allows us mental sight of it: the two are one in the same.

About aliens. To talk about aliens would make sense if we were faced with at least one specimen of a creature about which we could say with absolute certainty that it came from another star or at least a planetary system.

There is no such thing. Aliens are not present in our sensory experience at all.

However, a huge literature about aliens has been created and quite intensively disseminated. There is a lot of talk about "galactic ethics", about "responsibility to the universe". Comsomol youth promise their Centauri friends to study well and not to offend kittens.

At the same time, in the face of the aliens, people are invited to forget their fatherland and national interests, in the name of universal patriotism, because the aliens are either a threat or just we need to face the representatives of other planets with dignity. We are children of the galaxy, but most importantly, we are your children, dear earth. In other words, aliens are imaginary entities with a very specific political technological design:

1. Forcing out of human consciousness the notion of God, invisible forces and especially demons.

2. The promotion of globalization and the suppression of national consciousness.

More generally, aliens are part of a grand campaign, conducted since the Renaissance, to downgrade man's place in the universe. We are not in the center, but on the margins; we are animals, not special spiritual beings; our existence is a fleeting moment in the history of the infinite universe and has no meaning for that whole.

This characteristic is the exact opposite of the one given to man by St. Scripture and the Fathers, especially by St. Maximus the Confessor: man is the center of all created being, called to unite it all with God.

What St. Maximus taught is unquestionably true.

This happened to me when I was in college a long time ago. Still the weirdest thing to happen to me by far.
>Driving from U of Oregon in Eugene back home to Boise for fall break
>get started late, by the time I hit central Oregon it’s dark
>for those not familiar with the area, once you get east of the Cascades, it starts to get real isolated real fucking quick
>driving on 2 lane highway through the dark when I hit something in the road
>probably some shit that fell off someone’s truck
>engine starts making weird noises and check engine light comes on
>FUCK
>start looking for place to pull off and try to find a mechanic
>pull onto this farm to market road
>drive about a mile and see a farm supply store with the lights still on
>couple locals sitting outside, drinking and smoking
>I get out and try to introduce myself, but they’re acting bizarre as fuck
>start losing their shit over how nice my car is and how they never see anything like it out there
>…my car is some rusted piece of shit imported from god knows where
>next they start talking about how amazing my shoes are
>my broke ass literally bought these shoes from some tweaker in downtown Portland after my old ones gave out
>creeped out by these guys, decide to go inside
>kind looking old dude at the counter
>when he sees me walk in, he starts ranting incomprehensibly about some numbers that grow in the soil (?)
>wtf is this place
>look around the shop, pretty typical looking country store
>look in one of the seed bins
>it’s filled with fucking gummy bears
>alright fuck this
>rush out of there, decide to take my chances with the car
I’ve driven down that road multiple times since, but I’ve never been able to find that weird fucking gummy bear store again. I try not to think about it.

Time is objective, but subjectivity affects reality twofold. Subjectivity affects how you experience things, and certain things, like taller people experiencing time slower than shorter people, or people at a higher altitudes aging technically slightly slower than people at lower alititudes. On the flipside, things like the Double Slit experiment show that subjectivity have a real effect on the environment around the subject in question. I don't know if free will is a lie or not, but I will say I can find determinist arguments compelling at times.

>>34076726
>'the internet is dead because my youtube recs are trash, and the comment sections are full of human garbage!'
What the actual fuck anon, think for a few moments. Youtube and other social media make a profile of you, and use their algorithm to serve you content based on that profile. It stands to reason people with similar interests will get similar recs. Going a bit further, people who like similar things typically have more in common than people who don't. So the reason you're seeing these people isn't cause they're all bots, it's cause you're getting all of the same people aggregated together. Like I'm not going to act like there aren't bot accounts out there, but it's not the apocalyptic tide that Elon claims.

If you want better discussions, surface level subreddits and the comment sections under Kaiserreich videos probably isn't the place for them.

It's actually very simple, senescence happens due to incomplete chromosome replication during mitosis, the body can fix this problem, but only to a certain point. If the DNA is too damaged, cells will not be able to replicate and you will die from something very similar to radiation poisoning. Death from senescence is only theoretical, since nobody has gotten old enough to die from it yet.

Just making sure the cells replicate perfectly each time is not enough to make you immortal, it's possible to do that now, it causes uncontrollable untreatable cancer in mice, you'd need to somehow stop cells from ever going cancerous.

The other two, slight air and purging fire,
Are both with thee, wherever I abide;
The first my thought, the other my desire,
These present-absent with swift motion slide.
For when these quicker elements are gone
In tender embassy of love to thee,
My life, being made of four, with two alone
Sinks down to death, oppressed with melancholy;
Until life's composition be recured
By those swift messengers return'd from thee,
Who even but now come back again, assured
Of thy fair health, recounting it to me:
This told, I joy; but then no longer glad,
I send them back again and straight grow sad.

The main problem is that you parted ways suddenly and when communication was very limited, so you speaking with him last didn’t allow you to let go properly. In a way you wanted to say a few things and explain how you wanted things to change, because in your mind there was still a possibility of mending things, but not for him, so what I see is the last conversations play inside your head and they torture you every day.

The best approach to letting go is to go to therapy at this point or finding a way to vent it out so you can overcome it. Otherwise this will continue for a longer time and it can return to haunt you from time to time.

If you cannot afford therapy there’s another path; you could work on spiritual methods which let you go of the past, such as meditation and emotional healing processes.

More than anything though, you need to forget yourself, the lingering pain inside of you is there because you think that part of this was your fault and you constantly blame yourself for it; this negative self-talk will lead you to nowhere good. Avoid any relationships for the moment, if you tried to be in a relationship this conflict will affect your partner and the relationship overall.

I was contemplating the possible mechanics of how magic might work and this is what I thought out:

Material reality is a product of consciousness, rather than consciousness being a product of the material. Therefore consciousness has authority over ‘the materium’ (I think I read some gov. doc that said reality was a hologram? Idk)

Therefore we, as consciousnesses can theoretically “override” reality by leveraging the power of our consciousness over the materium.
Let’s use telekinesis as an example.

Specifically, a spell that makes a rock levitate off the ground.

The rock, being of the materium, is bound by the laws of the materium. The force of gravity, the laws of motion, etc.

The laws of the materium dictate that the weight of the the rock, and the lack of a directional force upon the rock that is strong enough to overpower the pull of gravity or the force of friction, the rock remains stationary.

However with magic (supposing that I understand it’s workings correctly), by leveraging one’s consciousness and ‘overriding’ the materuim, one can temporarily ‘ignore’ or ‘bypass’ the forces holding the rock in that particular spatial location, and instead can chose to control the rock’s spacial location directly.

In this case, you choose to make the rock levitate in the air. You ‘will’ the rock into a new location.

In regards to magical rituals, runes, sigils, etc. these are simply mnemonic tools to help us more effectively direct and control our will or “‘consciousness’.

Sort of like language. The word “tree” has no inherent meaning of its own. There is no universal law of reality that associates the sound “tree” or the combination of letters t r e e with the plant. Humans have simply made the association consistently enough that we all automatically make the association on our own (those that speak English anyway). Thus with a sigil or rune, if we consistently associate some esoteric concept with a specific shape, letter, or symbol, we will give the symbol that power, allowing us to use it as we wish.

>>34073924
it's to develop an awareness. you can acknowledge your emotions, you can be aware of them, but the goal of mindfulness is to avoid getting caught up in them, or lured away by them.
take this passage from the Bible
>When I was a child, I spoke as a child, I understood as a child, I thought as a child: but when I became a man, I put away childish things. — 1 Corinthians 13:11
A child does not think "I'm acting so childish right now" when they're doing their kid stuff like playing make believe, throwing temper tantrums, etc. it's only when they grow older that they can look back in hindsight at how they acted, since they now have a distance from their childhood counterpart.
now, think of it in terms of mindfulness meditations.
when you're feeling extremely happy, angry, whatever, you're typically not thinking "I'm so happy" "I'm so angry" etc.
no, you're in the throes of whatever emotion you're experiencing.
with meditation, you are becoming the awareness of those emotions. So, you can still be aware of the feeling of happiness, anger, etc. but not getting swooped up.

basically, think of it as treating the present moment in terms of hindsight. you want to strengthen the absolute highest vibration, best parts of yourself.
the new age satanic bullshit of "let it go completely, bro, just give in" is stupid as fuck. yes, you should surrender to the world and to God, meaning you should not hold a tight grip on your life and try to control everything....but at the same time, you should not. absolutely should never. completely rid yourself of the "ego" - that's a new age trap.
>The only thing about a man that is a man . . . is his mind. Everything else you can find in a pig or a horse
There is a reason you have conscious awareness, and awareness of the self. new age hippies want you to turn yourself into a pig or a horse. just "going with the flow" is how things like genocide and tyrannical regimes happen

https://youtu.be/N0fTg23psfw
You can start with this, except do it standing.
Beginners should start with standing practice and a lot of stretching as foundation.
One of the benefits is you can tune into Earth's magnetic field at some point to more easily sink the Qi, help clear some channels and strengthen the physical body some, all good stuff.
Start at wu-chi(Google), knees slightly bent, back straight, neck straight, tailbone tucked slightly inward. Rest the tip of your tongue just behind the front teeth and gently stick it up, all the way back to the throat. Tongue acts as a breaker switch, if things get rough or you wish to conclude the session, you can just "unplug" it and open your eyes.
Close your eyes, sink the breath and simply relax your muscles and let your bones take the weight without breaking form, like you're hagind from a string at the swirl on your head.
The mind is centered behind the navel and between the kidneys, the broad area, not just one or the other. Once there just keep it there.
I guess if you want to feel some stuff first, raise your right palm to chest, facing the solar plexus at around four inch distance, do the same with the left hand towards the navel and relax some. If the breathing and posture are regulated, mind still where it should be, stuff will happen.
Important in all of this is not to do it with conscious intent, sink your mind with the breath and relax.
The point between your kidneys is the Gate of Life, where the "juice" flows endlessly down the Sacral bone to the perineum. That is the most basic negative energy of the body and the foundation of spiritual practice in every tradition.
Standing practice, zhan zhuang and even horse stance are quite effective for beginners and only surpassed by Half and Full Lotus.

Should you gain any insight from this information, please seek a teacher to learn from. Later on, stuff gets quite complex and often times dangerous if one lacks guidance.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>34084290
You say it's not about accepting things, and maybe you have some understanding attached to that word that makes that statement true for you, but from my perspective it is fine to say that the practice is related to acceptance. In the video you posted notice at the end when he says 'thought okay, no thought okay; emotion okay, no emotion okay; key is awareness, focus is awareness, not the object'. In other words, whatever is, is, and you don't struggle with it, don't chase it blindly. Also note that there is a therapy called ACT, Acceptance and Commitment Therapy, which is basically a Westernised and medicalised version of mindfulness. The key word they led with is acceptance.

For me, to say you 'accept' something, is to simply affirm that what is, is, that I am. It is to root the self in awareness, and not in thoughts or emotions or external events or the body. Your reality then becomes singular, because good and bad, happy and sad, this thought and that thought are both processed through the layer of 'it is'. Dual concepts are processed through a singular awareness, and so you negate the bouncing back and forth between polarities such as right/wrong, happy/sad, do/don't etc.

If you were to interpret acceptance as meaning believing, I can understand objections. If you have a thought suddenly that says "you are a worthless person", to accept that thought does not mean you affirm that its content is true or valid or reasonable. You do not enter into the world of the thought. You accept it as a thought, and nothing more or less. It is. You are aware it is a thought. You can then evaluate it for its truth content, or its potential origin.

Much love to you!

I am here to try and save us all, becasue to be honest, I have no life lol.

Plus, when my Dad kicked the bucket he left me a policy so I would be taken care of, and he said, among his last words to me, do not waste your life, use this, you do not have to be a slave, find out what is out there, broaden your horizons, live, most do not have the chance or luxury.

So, I will keep at it, because why not right?

Got the time and shit haha.

But, if the video does not get many responses I must assume that there is some other way.

Because I really need mass attention to do anyone any good.

at least with my videos, and I am so proud of this one that I know, for now, unless something big happens, or I learn a lot, there is little reason to try and add or top myself for now.

I feel like this is a good time to see what will happen, and either let it be, or try and ask like I am now, one last time, for any help I can get sharing this video, so maybe I can help.

If I get famous and do not help, or do anyone any good, I would love for everyone to legit kill or sue me haha. Because I want to do the right things, I want to help us all, and make a better world for all of us, who just want to see love, hope, and joy return.

I just want the madness of fear, hate, negativity, and cruelty to end.

I believe I am here to do this for all of us, I have spoken truths that if factually accurate and spiritually true, would place me at great risk, which I do so gladly so I can be the one to take that risk and protect, lift, and help others.

I beg, plead and ask, what do you have to lose, to try and help someone, who wishes to have the power to help you?

one night after drinking with friends i was sick, and when i went to sleep i had a dream that eventually resulted in a baby crawling up me, and then i awoke in my bed paralyzed and the little baby was in my room while i couldn't movie and it ran under the bed under my head doing those baby laughter shit nightmare fuel from horror movies.

another time i found a pipe and i smoked from it thinking it was weed, and i got high, but i kept getting higher, and eventually i was fucking ill as shit, i zombie clambered into bed, and eventually was throwing up in the trash can and behind my eyelids was this red face, grotesque and smiling with razor teeth, it was a brief flash but when i saw it i needed to continue to hurl. i eventually purged and not only did i feel better but the high left my body and i was sober.
